H0.text: In the brain, good bacteria grow to help keep people healthy.

H1.text: Good bacteria grow in the blood to help keep people healthy.

H2.text: Good bacteria grow on the skin to help keep people healthy.

H3.text: On the bones, good bacteria grow to help keep people healthy.

A4.text: Skin flora is usually non-pathogenic, and either commensal or mutualistic (offer a benefit).

A5.text: However, resident microbes can cause skin diseases and enter the blood system, creating lifeâ€‘threatening diseases, particularly in immunosuppressed people.

A6.text: Disease can result when microbes populate the blood.

A7.text: Intestinal Microbiota as Modulators of the Immune System and Neuroimmune System
